data.title: Prime Video: F2 Kicks Off
data.meta_description: 'F2 Kicks Off' is the F2's journey through their city, their home and the place where everything for them began. In their first television series, Billy Wingrove and Jeremy Lynch journey across London, pulling off unbelievable feats of skill and breathtaking stunts astonishing everyone they meet, whether international footballers, chart topping musicians, or the everyday people of London.
data.text:
In the first ever episode of F2 Kicks Off, Billy and Jeremy take to the streets of Shoreditch, where they perform their magic in the quirky Fabrique bakery, amaze commuters with a breathtaking display of skills on a busy traffic island, and visit the iconic Covent Garden Piazza where they put on a surprise performance in-front of hundreds of people.

In Episode 2, the F2 head to Carnaby street in the trendy West End to wow crowds of people, cause chaos in a sports shop, show their magic to 5-a-side teams at Wembley Stadium, head to Arsenal FC's stadium to meet up with number 1 selling artist "Wretch 32", and team up with pro racing driver "Tom Chilton" for an adrenaline fuelled football-meets-car collaboration.

In Episode 3, the F2 take their magic to the world famous Portobello Road Market, amaze dog walkers along the Camden Canal, perform their tricks at death defying heights in the Emirates Airline, and take on their riskiest challenge to date by Chelsea Bridge, all in front of "MC Harvey" from the chart topping "So Solid Crew".

In Episode 4, the F2 burst in on a busy London Office, perform on the streets in High Street Kensington, pull off an incredible stunt with some of London's famous red buses at a West Ham bus depot, have their skills tested to the limit by Premiership striker "Darren Bent" at the 400 year old Spitalfields Market, and wow crowds in the heart of Europe's busiest street - Oxford Circus.

In Episode 5, the F2 are called out and challenged by two twitter tyrants at Fortismere secondary school, head back to their old haunts in Finsbury Park to make everyone's day at a hand carwash, have their accuracy tested in Soho Square, take to the streets of China Town for a unique display of magic, and team up with parkour pioneers "3Run" for an unbelievable collaboration display.

In Episode 6, the F2 perform some magic on the streets of Soho, stun crowds at Covent Garden's Seven Dials, burst in on a Neals Yard Smoothie Store, visit the world famous Columbia Road flower market to wow hundreds of hipsters including Russell Brand and attempt an unbelievable world first - a 60 yard alley-oop in the Olympic Park with pro basketballers from the London Lions.

In Episode 7, Billy and Jeremy head home to their families where we find out more about their past and where everything started as we journey through East London and Tottenham. Meet up with the worlds strongest footballer Bayo Aakinfenwa, football freestyle at adrenaline fueled speeds in Europe's biggest wind tunnel, and head to Alexandra palace Ice Rink for some Ice cold stunts.

In Episode 8, Billy and Jeremy head to the famous Kick Bar in East London where they take on a challenge for some of the locals, join Hollywoods A-list elite in Madam Taussads to perform amongst the famous Wax Works, take their skills to Great Ormond Street hospital to put a smile on the young kids faces, and team up with Pro flatland BMXer "Matti Hemmings" for a spectacular collaboration.

In Episode 9, the F2 appear on one of the UK's top football shows - 14 to 1 - dragging the presenters out onto the streets to pull off something spectacular, hangout with superstar rapper Tinchy Stryder, perform some breathtaking tricks in front of Big Ben, and amaze hundreds of late night commuters with a death defying display from 200 ft in the air - bringing the city to a complete stop.

In Episode 10, the F2 head to the iconic Cutty Sark in Greenwich to thrill crowds of people, they team up with the Golf Trickshot Boys for an unbelievable football-meets-golf collaboration with plenty of trickshots and skill, and head to the Thames with chart topping rapper Lethal Bizzle, where they show him something truly remarkable at Tower Bridge.

In Episode 11, the F2 are invited in to the Foreign Office where they perform their tricks to some of the countries most influential ministers, team up with urban street magician Ryan Tricks where they wow crowds of people with "the fastest football trick in the world", and pull off an adrenaline fuelled stunt at 10,000 feet above the ground!

In Episode 12 the F2 and are challenged to break 2 impossible world records from the top of a 150ft crane, they show off their skills in Regents Park, take on a snooker trick shot at Kings Cross snooker club, and are invited on to BBC's The One Show to perform live in front of 4 million people.

In Episode 13 the F2 attempt to smash 4 panes of reinforced glass with the frontman of chart topping boyband Blue - Anthony Costa; team up with Pro FMX Motocross Freestyler Jamie Squibb for a football-meets-bike stunt collaboration, take their skills to a North London tennis club, amaze crowds of fans in Dalston and link up with UK rapper Bashy.

In Episode 14 the F2 are challenged by top rugby team the Harlequins; attempt a basketball shot from the top of a London estate, take on a team of London's top paintball experts, take to the cities biggest casino, have fun at a London fun fair and attempt their toughest ever cross bar challenge on the Thames.

In Episode 15 we revisit some of the F2's best moments from series one with their celebrity friends. Including Wretch 32 at Asrenal FC, Darren Bent at Spitalfields market, Harvey in Battersea, Lethal Bizzle at Tower Bridge, Tom Chilton and his fast cars and Anthony Costa from Blue with his special glass smashing challenge.
